questions.question: In a resonance tube experiment, a tube of fixed length is closed at one end and several tuning forks of increasing frequency are used to obtain resonance at the open end. If the tuning fork with the lowest frequency which gave resonance had a frequency ƒ1 and the next tuning fork to give resonance had a frequency ƒ2, find the ratio ƒ2/ƒ1.
Which of the following is NOT a vector quantity?

Consider the three forces acting at O and in equilibrium as shown in Fig. 1. Which of the following equation(s) is/are correct? I. P1 cos O1 = P1 cos O2 II. P3 = P1 cos O1 + P2 cos O2 III. P1 sin O1 = P2 sin O2
Which of the following statements about friction is NOT correct?

options.A: The force of kinetic friction is less than the force of static friction
options.B: The force of kinetic friction between two surfaces is independent of the areas in contact provided the normal reaction is unchanged
options.C: The force of rolling friction between two surfaces is less than the force of sliding friction
options.D: The angle of friction is the angle between the normal reaction and the force of friction
options.E: Friction may be reduced by lubrication

questions.question: A brick at rest on a horizontal table is pulled by a horizontal cord, as shown in Fig. 2. The force of friction on the brick

options.A: Increases if the pull increases but the brick does not move
options.B: Is directly horizontal to the right
options.C: Decreases if an identical brick is placed on the first
options.D: Is zero if the brick is pulled hard enough to make it slide
options.E: Changes if the brick is turned on its side

questions.question: The force with which an object is attracted to the earth is called its
The refractive index of a liquid is 1.5. If the velocity of light in vacuum is 3.0 x 10^8 m/s, the velocity of light in the liquid is
If the relative density of a metal is 19, what will be the mass of 20 cm³ of the metal when immersed in water?
Which of the following statements about liquid pressure is NOT correct? The pressure

options.A: At a point in a liquid is proportional to the depth
options.B: At any point in a liquid is the same at the same level
options.C: Is exerted equally in all directions at any point
options.D: Of a liquid at any point on the wall of its container is zero
options.E: All of the above are correct except D

questions.question: A ship traveling towards a cliff receives the echo of its whistle after 3.5 seconds. A short while later, it receives the echo after 2.5 seconds. If the speed of sound in air under the prevailing conditions is 250 m/s, how much closer is the ship to the cliff?

Which of the following is NOT correct? I. The pitch of a sound note depends on the frequency of vibrations. II. The intensity of a sound note is proportional to the amplitude of vibrations. III. Beats are produced by two sources of sound because one wave is travelling faster than the other. IV. When two sources of sound of frequencies 500 Hz and 502 Hz are sounded together, a neat frequency of 2 Hz is observed. V. The first harmonic of a note has double the frequency of the fundamental note.

Which of the following statements about defects of vision is/are CORRECT? I. For a long sighted person, close objects appear blurred. II. For a short sighted person, distant objects appear blurred. III. Short sight is corrected by using a pair of converging lenses.
The range of wavelengths of the visible spectrum is 400nm–700nm. The wavelength of gamma rays is

options.B: Shorter than 700 nm but longer than 400 nm

questions.question: If the pressure on 1000 cm³ of an ideal gas is doubled while its Kelvin temperature is halved, then the new volume of the gas will become
A train has an initial velocity of 44 m/s and an acceleration of –4 m/s². Its velocity after 10 seconds is

Which of the following conditions are necessary and sufficient for total internal reflection to take place at the boundary between two optical media? I. Light is passing from optically denser medium to optically less dense medium. II. Light is passing from optically less dense medium to optically denser medium. III. Angle of incidence is greater. IV. Angle of incidence is lesser.
A man of mass 50 kg ascends a flight of stairs 5 m high in 5 seconds. If acceleration due to gravity is 10 m/s², the power expended is
Which of the following arrangements in the sequence shown can be used to obtain a pure spectrum of white light? Source, slit, prism, diverging lens, screen.

options.A: Source, slit, converging lens, prism, converging lens, screen
options.C: Source, converging lens, prism, diverging lens, screen
options.D: Source, slit, prism, diverging lens, screen

questions.question: A milliammeter with full scale deflection of 100 mA has an internal resistance of 5 ohms. It would be converted to an ammeter with a full scale deflection of 1 A by connecting a resistance of

It is usual to transmit electric power at high voltage and low current. Which of the following are possible advantages of the method? I. Heat losses are reduced because the currents are small. II. Thin wires can be used because small currents are flowing. III. The power can flow faster because the voltage is high.
